frame.name: Proximity_image_schema
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Profiled_region</fen> is picked out which is near to (or far from) the <fen>Ground</fen> to a certain <fen>Degree</fen>. The <fen>Profiled_region</fen> cannot contact or overlap the location of the <fen>Ground</fen>, as this is categorically different--see Contact_image_schema and Collocation_image_schema.</def-root>

FE.name: Near_profiled_region
FE.definition: <def-root>A region of space located relative to a <fen>Ground</fen> that is maximally relevant near the <fen>Ground</fen>, with decreasing applicability away from the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity whose location is relatively well-known and which, thus, can serve as a land-mark to identify the <fen>Profiled_region</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount of deviation from an idealized expected distance of the <fen>Profiled_region</fen> from the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Distant_profiled_region
FE.definition: <def-root>A region of space located relative to a <fen>Ground</fen> that is not relevant near the <fen>Ground</fen>, with increasing applicability away from the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>
